title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 214.2 - Suspension or other sanctions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 214.2 - Suspension or other sanctions

State Regulations

Misconduct by an attorney or other representative before the
agency, including but not limited to misconduct at a hearing, shall be grounds
for discipline. Such misconduct, if of an aggravated character, may be grounds
for suspension and for prohibiting the attorney or representative from practice
before the agency and for other sanctions after due notice and a hearing before
the board or its designee. Any order of an administrative law judge imposing
discipline under this section will be appealable to the board as part of an
appeal of the ultimate disposition of the underlying proceeding pursuant to
section
212.4
(d) of this

Chapter, or, upon a showing of extraordinary circumstances, under section
213.4
of this

Chapter. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4
ยง
214.2

Amended

New

York State Register August 2, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 31, eff. 8/2/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
